intro: Topobea brenesii, commonly known as the Brena's topobea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
